query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
1 Era lo loco ov’ a scender la riva 2 venimmo, alpestro e, per quel che v’er’ anco, 3 tal, ch’ogne vista ne sarebbe schiva.
query.error: **English:** 1 Now we had come to the place where we were to descend the bank, 2 a rugged place, and, because of what was there, 3 such that any sight would shun it.
query.result: 1 Þa wæs ðæt stow ðær we steortende 2 niðer on ðone wudu westenne and wilde, 3 swylce næfre nænig mon ær ne geseah.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
4 Qual è quella ruina che nel fianco 5 di qua da Trento l’Adice percosse, 6 o per tremoto o per sostegno manco,
query.error: **English:** 4 What is that ruin that on this side of Trent 5 the Adige struck on its flank, 6 either through an earthquake or through lack of support,
query.result: 4 Hwæt is ðæt wundor ðæt on ðisum sidan Trentan 5 Adige oferfleow on his foldan bæce, 6 oððe ðurh eorðstyrunge oððe ðurh stefnan gebrec,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
7 che da cima del monte, onde si mosse, 8 al piano è sì la roccia discoscesa, 9 ch’alcuna via darebbe a chi sù fosse:
query.error: **English:** 7 that from the top of the mountain, from where it moved, 8 to the plain the rock has fallen so far, 9 that it would give some way to anyone who was up there:
query.result: 7 ðæt of ðæs beorgæs hliðe, ðær hit ær arn up, 8 on ðone feld becom swa feor gewiten, 9 ðæt hit sumne weg syllan wolde ðam ðe þær ufan wære:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
10 cotal di quel burrato era la scesa; 11 e ’n su la punta de la rotta lacca 12 l’infamïa di Creti era distesa
query.error: **English:** 10 such was the descent of that ravine; 11 and on the edge of the broken precipice 12 the infamy of Crete was spread out,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
13 che fu concetta ne la falsa vacca; 14 e quando vide noi, sé stesso morse, 15 sì come quei cui l’ira dentro fiacca.
query.error: **English:** 13 who was conceived in the false cow; 14 and when he saw us, he bit himself, 15 like one whose anger breaks him within.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
16 Lo savio mio inver’ lui gridò: «Forse 17 tu credi che qui sia ’l duca d’Atene, 18 che sù nel mondo la morte ti porse?
query.error: **English:** 16 My wise guide cried out to him: "Perhaps 17 you think that the Duke of Athens is here, 18 who brought you death up in the world?
query.result: 16 Min wisa meastor wið hine cleopode: "Hwæt, 17 wenstu ðæt her sie se heretoga Aðena, 18 se ðe ðe on worulde deað forgeaf?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
19 Pàrtiti, bestia, ché questi non vene 20 ammaestrato da la tua sorella, 21 ma vassi per veder le vostre pene».
query.error: **English:** 19 Depart, beast, for this man does not come 20 taught by your sister, 21 but he goes to see your punishments."
query.result: 19 Gewit ðu, deofol, for ðes ne cymeð 20 gelæred fram ðinre sweostor, 21 ac he gæð ðurh ða deopan dalas."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
22 Qual è quel toro che si slaccia in quella 23 c’ha ricevuto già ’l colpo mortale, 24 che gir non sa, ma qua e là saltella,
query.error: **English:** 22 Like is the bull that breaks loose in the arena 23 after receiving the mortal blow, 24 that knows not where to turn, but leaps here and there,
query.result: 22 Swylce is ðæt steorra ðe ðone stiðan wyrm 23 of ðam heafde hweorfeð heardne æt hilde, 24 ðæt he ne mæg ða wunde forfleon, ac he wyrm sefað,

query.error: **English:** 25 so I saw the Minotaur do; 26 and that astute one cried: "Run to the passage, 27 while he is raging, it is good that you descend."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
28 Così prendemmo via giù per lo scarco 29 di quelle pietre, che spesso moviensi 30 sotto i miei piedi per lo novo carco.
query.error: **English:** 28 Thus we took our way down through the precipice 29 of those stones, which often shifted 30 beneath my feet because of the new burden.
query.result: 28 Þus we ða stigoðan steapne niðer 29 ðara stanana, ðe oft hruron 30 under minum fotum for ðam niwan byrðene.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
31 Io gia pensando; e quei disse: «Tu pensi 32 forse a questa ruina, ch’è guardata 33 da quell’ ira bestial ch’i’ ora spensi.
query.error: **English:** 31 I was already thinking; and he said: "Perhaps you are thinking 32 about this ruin, which is guarded 33 by that bestial wrath which I just extinguished.
query.result: 31 Ic ða ðohte; and he cwæð: "Þu ðenceð 32 be ðisse hryre, ðe is gehealden 33 fram ðam bestialum irre ðe ic ær ofsloh.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
34 Or vo’ che sappi che l’altra fïata 35 ch’i’ discesi qua giù nel basso inferno, 36 questa roccia non era ancor cascata.
query.error: **English:** 34 Now I want you to know that the other time 35 that I descended down here into the lowest hell, 36 this rock had not yet fallen.
query.result: 34 Nu ic wille ðæt ðu wite ðæt ða oðre siðe 35 ðe ic nider astah on ðone deopan hell, 36 ðeos stan hwilum ne wæs giet gebrocen.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
37 Ma certo poco pria, se ben discerno, 38 che venisse colui che la gran preda 39 levò a Dite del cerchio superno,
query.error: **English:** 37 But surely a little before, if I discern well, 38 when he came who took the great prey 39 from Dis of the circle above,
query.result: 37 Ac soðlice lyt ðærbeforan, gif ic rihte geseo, 38 ðaða com se ðe ða mæran bryde 39 Dite ofnam of ðam hean hringe,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
40 da tutte parti l’alta valle feda 41 tremò sì, ch’i’ pensai che l’universo 42 sentisse amor, per lo qual è chi creda
query.error: **English:** 40 on all sides the deep, foul valley 41 trembled so that I thought the universe 42 felt love, for which some believe
query.result: 40 on ælce healfe ða hean dene dimme 41 bifode swa ðæt ic wende ðæt ðeos wide grund 42 lufode, ðurh ðæt sume men wenad

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
43 più volte il mondo in caòsso converso; 44 e in quel punto questa vecchia roccia, 45 qui e altrove, tal fece riverso.
query.error: **English:** 43 the world has often been turned to chaos; 44 and at that moment this ancient rock, 45 here and elsewhere, made such a somersault.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
46 Ma ficca li occhi a valle, ché s’approccia 47 la riviera del sangue in la qual bolle 48 qual che per vïolenza in altrui noccia».
query.error: **English:** 46 But fix your eyes down below, for it approaches, 47 the river of blood in which boils 48 whoever harms others through violence.
query.result: 46 Ac fæst ðine eagan to ðære dene, for ðær genealæcð 47 ðæs blodes ea, on ðære seodeð 48 se ðe ðurh wælhreownysse oðrum wyrð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
49 Oh cieca cupidigia e ira folle, 50 che sì ci sproni ne la vita corta, 51 e ne l’etterna poi sì mal c’immolle!
query.error: **English:** 49 O blind cupidity and mad wrath, 50 that so spur us on in the short life, 51 and in the eternal then so ill engulf us!
query.result: 49 Eala, blinde gitsung and wod geornes, 50 ðe us swa spornath on ðisne scortan life, 51 and on ðam ecan ðonne swa yfle us besencath!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
52 Io vidi un’ampia fossa in arco torta, 53 come quella che tutto ’l piano abbraccia, 54 secondo ch’avea detto la mia scorta;
query.error: **English:** 52 I saw a wide fosse in an arc bent, 53 like that which all the plain encircles, 54 according as my escort had said;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
55 e tra ’l piè de la ripa ed essa, in traccia 56 corrien centauri, armati di saette, 57 come solien nel mondo andare a caccia.
query.error: **English:** 55 and between the foot of the bank and it, in a file, 56 centaurs were running, armed with arrows, 57 as they were wont to go hunting in the world.
query.result: 55 and betwux ðam fotes ðære ofre and ðære, on ræce, 56 urnon centauri, mid strælum gewæpnode, 57 swa swa hi wunedon on ðære worulde on huntaðe to farenne.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
58 Veggendoci calar, ciascun ristette, 59 e de la schiera tre si dipartiro 60 con archi e asticciuole prima elette;
query.error: **English:** 58 Seeing us descend, each one stopped, 59 and three of the company separated themselves, 60 with bows and arrows chosen beforehand;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
61 e l’un gridò da lungi: «A qual martiro 62 venite voi che scendete la costa? 63 Ditel costinci; se non, l’arco tiro».
query.error: **English:** 61 and one of them cried from afar: "To what torment 62 are you coming, you who descend the slope? 63 Tell us from there; if not, I draw the bow."
query.result: 61 and ða an ðara ðus cwæð of ðam folce feorran: 62 "To hwylcum wite ge willað, ðe ðas hleonas stigað? 63 Secgað ðæt ðanon, oððe ic ðone stræl sende."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
64 Lo mio maestro disse: «La risposta 65 farem noi a Chirón costà di presso: 66 mal fu la voglia tua sempre sì tosta».
query.error: **English:** 64 My master said: "We will give the answer 65 to Chiron over there, nearby: 66 your desire was always too hasty."
query.result: 64 Min lareow cwæð: "Þone andsware 65 we sculon wyrcan Chirone ðær gehende: 66 yfel wæs ðin willa symle swa trum."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
67 Poi mi tentò, e disse: «Quelli è Nesso, 68 che morì per la bella Deianira, 69 e fé di sé la vendetta elli stesso.
query.error: **English:** 67 Then he pointed out to me and said: "That is Nessus, 68 who died for the beautiful Deianira, 69 and took vengeance on himself."
query.result: 67 Þa he gewende and sæde: "Þæt is Nessus, 68 se ðe for Deianiran ðære fægran deaðe ðrowade, 69 and him sylfne wrac ðæs."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
70 E quel di mezzo, ch’al petto si mira, 71 è il gran Chirón, il qual nodrì Achille; 72 quell’ altro è Folo, che fu sì pien d’ira.
query.error: **English:** 70 And he in the middle, who looks at his chest, 71 is the great Chiron, who nursed Achilles; 72 the other is Pholus, who was so full of wrath.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
73 Dintorno al fosso vanno a mille a mille, 74 saettando qual anima si svelle 75 del sangue più che sua colpa sortille».
query.error: **English:** 73 Around the ditch they go in thousands, 74 shooting at any soul that swells up 75 with more blood than their sin allotted them.
query.result: 73 Ymb ðone dic goð þusenda talum, 74 sceotende ða sawle ðe ðær on blode weoll, 75 ðe ðurh heora synna ðone sið habbað.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
76 Noi ci appressammo a quelle fiere isnelle: 77 Chirón prese uno strale, e con la cocca 78 fece la barba in dietro a le mascelle.
query.error: **English:** 76 We drew near to those swift beasts: 77 Chiron took an arrow, and with the notch 78 drew back the beard upon his jaws.
query.result: 76 We nealæhton ðam hrade deorum: 77 Chiron nam ða ænne stræl, and ða mid ðære sceafte 78 ða beard on bæc his ceaflum teah.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
79 Quando s’ebbe scoperta la gran bocca, 80 disse a’ compagni: «Siete voi accorti 81 che quel di retro move ciò ch’el tocca?
query.error: **English:** 79 When he had uncovered his great mouth, 80 he said to his companions: "Have you noticed 81 that the one behind moves what he touches?
query.result: 79 Þa he hæfde his muðel miclan onwrigen, 80 he cwæð to his geferum: "Sind ge war geworden 81 ðæt se ðe ðær æfter gæð hrepo ðæt he hrepo?

Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
82 Così non soglion far li piè d’i morti». 83 E ’l mio buon duca, che già li er’ al petto, 84 dove le due nature son consorti,

85 rispuose: «Ben è vivo, e sì soletto 86 mostrar li mi convien la valle buia; 87 necessità ’l ci ’nduce, e non diletto.

Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
88 Tal si partì da cantare alleluia 89 che mi commise quest’ officio novo: 90 non è ladron, né io anima fuia.

query.result: 88 Þus he gewende fram þam lofsange 89 and bebead me þisne niwan cræft: 90 nis he na sceapa, ne ic sawol fleonde.

94 e che ne mostri là dove si guada, 95 e che porti costui in su la groppa, 96 ché non è spirto che per l’aere vada».

query.result: 94 and ðe us tæce hwær ðæt wæd is, 95 and ðe ðisne man bære on his hrycg, 96 forðam he nis gast ðe ðurh ðone lyft gæð."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
97 Chirón si volse in su la destra poppa, 98 e disse a Nesso: «Torna, e sì li guida, 99 e fa cansar s’altra schiera v’intoppa».
query.error: **English:** 97 Chiron turned to the right gunwale, 98 and said to Nessus: "Turn back, and guide them, 99 and make the other troop yield if they encounter you."
query.result: 97 Kyron him gewende on ða swiðran healfe, 98 and cwæð to Nesse: "Gewend ðe, and læd hi, 99 and do ðæt oðer werod gewice gif hi ðe on cumað."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
100 Or ci movemmo con la scorta fida 101 lungo la proda del bollor vermiglio, 102 dove i bolliti facieno alte strida.
query.error: **English:** 100 Now we moved on with our faithful escort 101 along the bank of the boiling crimson, 102 where the boiled souls were shrieking loudly.
query.result: 100 Þa we furðor ferdon mid ðære treowan trywðe 101 wið ðæs weallendes wæteres brimme, 102 þær ða seððan sæton and wopon.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
103 Io vidi gente sotto infino al ciglio; 104 e ’l gran centauro disse: «E’ son tiranni 105 che dier nel sangue e ne l’aver di piglio.
query.error: **English:** 103 I saw people submerged up to their eyebrows; 104 and the great centaur said: “These are tyrants 105 who laid violent hands on blood and treasure.

Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.

Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
112 fu spento dal figliastro sù nel mondo». 113 Allor mi volsi al poeta, e quei disse: 114 «Questi ti sia or primo, e io secondo».
query.error: **English:** 112 was killed by his stepson up in the world. 113 Then I turned to the poet, and he said: 114 "Let this one be your guide now, and I will be second."
query.result: 112 wæs ofslegen fram his stiefsunu upp on ðære worulde. 113 Þa ic me wende to ðam wyrhtan, and he cwæð: 114 "Þes ðe beo nu forma, and ic æfter."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
115 Poco più oltre il centauro s’affisse 116 sovr’ una gente che ’nfino a la gola 117 parea che di quel bulicame uscisse.
query.error: **English:** 115 A little farther on, the centaur stopped 116 over a group of people who seemed to be 117 emerging from that boiling stream up to their throats.
query.result: 115 Lythwon færræð se centaurus 116 ofer ða leoda ðe oð ða swuran 117 ðuhte ðæt hi of ðam weallendan wætere eodon.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
118 Mostrocci un’ombra da l’un canto sola, 119 dicendo: «Colui fesse in grembo a Dio 120 lo cor che ’n su Tamisi ancor si cola».
query.error: **English:** 118 He showed me a shade by himself on one side, 119 saying: "He made in the lap of God 120 the heart that still bleeds on the Thames."
query.result: 118 Hē āteowde mē ānne sceadu be him sylfum on ōðre healfe, 119 cweðende: "Hē geworhte on Godes bearme 120 ðæt heorte ðe gēna on Temese blēdeð."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
121 Poi vidi gente che di fuor del rio 122 tenean la testa e ancor tutto ’l casso; 123 e di costoro assai riconobb’ io.
query.error: **English:** 121 Then I saw people who, outside of the river, 122 were holding their heads and still all of their necks; 123 and of these I recognized many.
query.result: 121 Þa geseah ic folc ðe utan ðæs wæteres 122 heora heafod and eac ealne heora hals 123 hæfdon; and ðara ic fela gecneow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
124 Così a più a più si facea basso 125 quel sangue, sì che cocea pur li piedi; 126 e quindi fu del fosso il nostro passo.
query.error: **English:** 124 Thus more and more the blood became shallower, 125 so that it cooked only our feet; 126 and thus we passed out of the ditch.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
130 che da quest’ altra a più a più giù prema 131 lo fondo suo, infin ch’el si raggiunge 132 ove la tirannia convien che gema.

query.result: 130 ðæt of ðisse oðre ma and ma niðor 131 his grund gesihð, oð ðæt he geræceð 132 ðær ðe tiris ðolian sceal."

136 le lagrime, che col bollor diserra, 137 a Rinier da Corneto, a Rinier Pazzo, 138 che fecero a le strade tanta guerra».

query.result: 139 Þa he hine wende and ofer wæter wód.
